full_text:
The Midland Metro is a light-rail/tram line in the West Midlands of England operating between Birmingham and Wolverhampton via West Bromwich and Wednesbury. It is owned and promoted by Centro, and operated by National Express Midland Metro, a subsidiary of National Express.
It opened on 30 May 1999, mostly using the former disused Birmingham Snow Hill to Wolverhampton Low Level Line. An extension into Birmingham City Centre, was approved in 2012, and is expected to be operational in early 2016. Various other extensions, including entirely new lines, have been proposed but not yet approved.
